column1: Set current label title. Only for admin purposes, not displayed in frontend.
column2: Set current label title. Only for admin purposes, not displayed in frontend.

column1: Use 0 for highest priority and bigger value for lowest priority.
column2: Use 0 for highest priority and bigger value for lowest priority.

column1:
Insert the label text. You can use variables for dynamic labels.
Variables that can be used:
{NL} - for new line, {DAYSLEFT} - days left for current label, {PRICE} - for product price, {SPECIAL_PRICE} - for product special prices, {DISCOUNT_PERCENT} - for product discount, in percent, {DISCOUNT_AMOUNT} - for product discount, as absolute value , {SKU} - for product SKU, {QTY} - for product stock Qty.
Example: {DISCOUNT_PERCENT} OFF - Save ${DISCOUNT_AMOUNT}
column2:
Insert the label text. You can use variables for dynamic labels.
Variables that can be used:
{NL} - for new line, {DAYSLEFT} - days left for current label, {PRICE} - for product price, {SPECIAL_PRICE} - for product special prices, {DISCOUNT_PERCENT} - for product discount, in percent, {DISCOUNT_AMOUNT} - for product discount, as absolute value , {SKU} - for product SKU, {QTY} - for product stock Qty.
Example: {DISCOUNT_PERCENT} OFF - Save ${DISCOUNT_AMOUNT}

column1: Insert font size for label's text. e.g.: 12px
column2: Insert font size for label's text. e.g.: 12px

column2: Customize product label and text styles with CSS parameters. e.g.: transform:rotate(320deg); border-radius:30px; margin-top: 12px;
